title: Kerry Katona reveals she's only been visited in hospital by one of her five kids

Kerry Katona said she has only been visited by one of her five children while she resides in hospital.

The singer, 39, stayed hooked up on a drip in hospital overnight after she was rushed to A&E with a mystery illness on Wednesday.

It's no wonder Kerry was so happy to see her youngest child Dylan-Jorge, five, whom she shares with her late ex-husband George Kay.

The mother-of-five documented her visit with a sweet snap that she shared on Instagram on Thursday.

In the cute photograph, Kerry wrapped her arms around Dylan-Jorge and they snuggled while sat on the hospital bed.

(Image: Instagram)

In jest, the mum joked she let her child Molly, 18, off because she acknowledged her eldest daughter "does live in another country".

She wrote alongside the snap: "Awww look who’s come to see me!!!! ❤️❤️❤️ 1 out of my 5!let @123_mollymc off as she does live in another country."

Kerry is also mum to Lily-Sue from her first marriage to Brian McFadden. She divorced the Westlife singer in 2004 after two years of marriage.

(Image: Instagram)

The former Atomic Kitten singer also shares Heidi, ten, and Max, nine, from her relationship with Mark Croft.

The Celebrity Big Brother star has been keeping her fans informed about her A&E trip as she revealed she was still waiting to hear for news from doctors.

She wrote "Still in hospital" before updating her fans with "Still in!!! No news!".

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

Kerry was supported by her boyfriend Ryan Mahoney when she headed to A&E.

Her love didn't leave her bedside as he was seen reclining in a chair in a sweet snap.

She gushed over her love as she was delighted to have the company during her hospital visit.

Kerry added: "Bless him! Keeping me company."

She didn't divulge the reason why she had taken the trip to the hospital with her admirers.

The Mirror has approached Kerry Katona's representative for further comment.
description: Kerry was delighted to see her youngest daughter Dylan-Jorge as she revealed she was the only one out of her five children to make the trip
